author: The Editorial Board
title: The Selloff Arrives, Finally
text:
Believe it or not, sometimes stocks go down. That eternal reality hit hard this week with the fall of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which dropped more than 650 points on Friday.
Friday’s jobs report was steady as she goes for the recovery—nonfarm payrolls increased 200,000 in January, and unemployment remained unchanged at 4.1%. But one measure that deserves particular notice is wage growth: Average hourly earnings increased 2.9% year-over-year. This is the fastest pace since 2009. An unfortunate artifact of the recovery...
